website_summaries.verdict: A classic combination of chocolate and peanut butter makes these bars a good choice for anyone who prefers tried-and-true flavors.
pros: Offers classic peanut butter and chocolate flavors in protein-rich bars
Similar to eating candy that contains both tasty treats
cons: Some quality-control issues, including stale, broken, or melted bars upon arrival

customer_reviews.title: Best Flavors, Worst Flavors and a Pro-tip
customer_reviews.text: Quest are the best. High in protein, little to no sugar and carbs and easily some of the best tasting bars out there. BEST FLAVORS: 1) Birthday Cake 2) Cookies and Cream 3) Peanut Butter Supreme 4) Rocky Road 5) Blueberry Muffin WORST FLAVORS (do not buy): 1) Vanilla Almond 2) Apple Pie 3) Strawberry Cheesecake PRO TIP: If you have time warm them up in the microwave for a few seconds. Maybe 5-10 depending on your microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: they changed the fiber and now I can't even eat them without terrible stomach issues
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a quest bar as a staple for my day, they changed the fiber and now I can't even eat them without terrible stomach issues. Such a bummer quest! Also I contacted quest directly and basically was told the stomach upset was because they are good for your stomach and I will get used to it. No I won't! I eat very healthy and don't need a gut clean out.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Clark

customer_reviews.title: corn fiber=stomach distress
customer_reviews.text: I loved Quest Bars, but since they've changed the formula to include corn fiber, they cause me terrible bloating and gas. They are not as good as when previously purchased.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: NOT a clean protein bar!
customer_reviews.text: I used to love Quest bars, cookie dough being my favorite. The former version of the bars were mostly clean, so I chose to overlook the small amount of suCralose. But now, after reformulating the bars, they Not only taste disgusting, but they are full of junk! More suCralose than before, corn fiber, which is likely GMO, and palm oil - one of the worst oils for you! Your claim that these bars are clean aNd have no added junk is an absolute lie, and you should be ashamed of yourselves for claiming such nonsense! I was spending around $130/month on Quest bars, but you have now lost my business completely unless you change your ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah H.

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient CASE!!!! Variable sizes????
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE the way these taste. I do NOT love the different sizes! I’m paying for full sized bars, not less portions...you can see the lot number and time stamp. Someone needs to get on the ball in production.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Whitley

customer_reviews.title: Soluble Corn Fiber is terrible for you
customer_reviews.text: It is associated with blood sugar spikes. I was eating a lower carb diet and then added these because they are low card and "keto friendly", but noticed that after I had eaten a few over a few days that I was hungry all the time! I started having almost uncontrollable hunger in the evenings all of a sudden, and this was the ONLY thing that changed. I decided to Google. Do your own research and come to your own conclusions, but this was my experience with this product. Its basically by-product and whey protein.
customer_reviews.author: Sugartown

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed for the worse.
customer_reviews.text: I have been ordering the Peanut Butter Chocolate Flavor for many years now and been very happy with it. With my last order I received the "new and improved" version. It is completely different. The flavor is horrible, the appearance and texture unappealing. It used to be a dark chocolate color with the taste of peanut butter. Now it is an unappetizing beige color with dark chunks in it and tastes chalky and fake. The first time I ate this new version, I experienced cramping and bloating. These changes have made this bar inedible and I won't be ordering them again. Bad move on the company's part.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S.

customer_reviews.title: Quest out for the almighty dollar, not customer satisfaction !
customer_reviews.text: Quest ruined my favorite bar by changing the formula adding corn fiber and palm oil. I want NEITHER in my bars. On their Facebook page they keep insisting that it was an improperly mixed batch .....REALLY??!!😳 ALL of the flavors ?! They also made it QUITE clear that they are NEVER going back to the old formula. DONE WITH QUEST ...after years of buying them. This shows how much they care about their customers ........THEY DONT!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Some flavors contain sucralose
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: some flavors contain sucralose. I ordered recently and should have scrolled all the way down for more detailed ingredients on all flavors. Of the flavors I purchased, Cookies and Cream, Apple Pie and Blueberry Muffic contain sucralose. As of this writing they don’t include that ingredient in the ingredients list in the top graphics, only in the list down further where most might miss it. Like I did. Ok, Quest, this purchase is on me. And it will be my last. Sucralose is an ingredient that should be clearly listed as most people do not ingest on Keto or Paleo diets....these bars are listed as Keto and Paleo friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Tippecanoe

customer_reviews.title: Found a piece of paper with writing on it INSIDE the bar! Gross!
customer_reviews.text: Found a piece of paper in the bar I was eating this morning. White paper with writing in pen on it. Totally disgusted - how good can their quality control be if this was in my food? I am horrified and don't know if I'll ever buy another one of these bars.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Yashinski

customer_reviews.title: Yuck won't buy again
customer_reviews.text: The bar I just tried eating had hard black pieces in it! Yuck!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Eiting

customer_reviews.title: New Chocolate Peanut Butter flavor disappointing
customer_reviews.text: For the second time Quest has updated the recipe of the Chocolate Peanut Butter bar since I've been buying them. The first time, it got a little softer and the taste change was minimal. Now it is like a whole new product and the taste is not at all good to me. The bar was a solid dark brown before and now is a light peanut butter brown color with chocolate chunks. I'd suggest picking up a single bar locally before picking up a box of the new flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Milby

customer_reviews.title: A negative star is the actual review
customer_reviews.text: Birthday Cake GF Quest bars are part of my monthly subscription but this month they were sent separately and took a long time to arrive. During that time, the cooling bag melted and the bars are inedible. They have melted, dried out and melted multiple times. I took a small bite and spit it out. I will need to remove Quest bars from my Amazon Subscription. Food in this state is a health hazard. Too much money for something I had to discard.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany A Noble

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good but not getting what you've paid for.
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this product for a while but the last two orders have been inconsistent. These later purchases are smaller but still have packaging indicating 2.12 ounces. But they are 1.85 ounces and noticeably skinnier. That's dishonest and I will not purchase again unless there is a reasonable answer for this false advertising or discrepency.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Delicious!!!
customer_reviews.text: Quest, you've done it again....already a fan of their bars, I was super excited to try this one.... Did not disappoint!!! I tried one the minute it was delivered....warm from being on the truck, it was AMAZING even not warm, they are truly delicious!!! Chocolate chip cookie dough "may" have just been replaced as my new favorite You will not be disappointed....so decadent, you will think you're eating a piece of lemon cake...being Keto, of course, cant have the real stuff....but this my friends is a great way to enjoy dessert again Way to go!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t Buy Chocolate Hazelnut
customer_reviews.text: So far my least favorite flavor (chocolate hazelnut). Pretty much a pure chocolate flavor, no trace of hazelnut. Bars are harder than the others. I’m not sure if it’s this particular bar flavor but these crumble a lot. All the other bars I’ve had are moist enough that you can bite them with no problems. These drop little fine crumbs of chocolate. When you try to pick them up or dust them off, they just smear into your clothes so expect to dirty your clothes. Overall I am disappointed with this bar and will not be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Bazan

customer_reviews.title: Remarkable Taste
customer_reviews.text: Quest has outdone themselves with their Birthday Cake Protein Bar. Personally, I like the high-protein, low-carb nutritional value and it tastes remarkably like a birthday cake! Along with regular exercise, Quest Bars have been instrumental in achieving my weight-loss goal of 87 lbs. during the past year. Even my Son - who is a very "picky" eater - eats one of these bars instead of cookies or candy for dessert.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plastic found in bar
customer_reviews.text: Bars are my favorite. One of the last ones we opened had a long plastic stuck inside it. Please watch video.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great, recently changed the formula! DO NOT EAT!
customer_reviews.text: Changed the formula or production issues! I've been buying these bars for over a year now. This last box was horrible!!! Chewy like hard taffy and then crumbly in between. I have to echo the comments of others here - these are either FAKE or Quest has ruined a decent product with a change in formula. I will no longer buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Joel T

customer_reviews.title: Add this one to the do not buy list
customer_reviews.text: Have tried 7 of the flavors - Chocolate sprinkled doughnut will undoubtedly still be the worst after I have tried them all. Can't taste chocolate or sprinkle parts because the doughnut part overrides everything with it's awfulness. Has a medicinal taste. Tried two in case the first was an outlier. Nope. Rest went in the trash. Great idea, really bad execution.
customer_reviews.author: Mongo

customer_reviews.title: Awful taste.
customer_reviews.text: Obviously taste is opinion, but being a cookie dough connoisseur I feel like my review is worth a read. Awful taste... I’m very confused at all the positive reviews. It has a very off-putting chemical-y pungent bite and after taste, nothing like cookie dough, or even the “safe to eat cookie dough”. I was really looking forward to these but I had one bite and instantly couldn’t take it. It’s not like one of those protein bars that “grows on you”, it was just terrible. Going to return if my boyfriend doesn’t like them.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Horrible! Worst protein bar ever!
customer_reviews.text: Of course this is my opinion and we all have different taste buds and preferences, but I couldn't even manage to eat 1 whole bar. The taste and texture are horrible. I tried to eat 1 bar so I would take a bite of the bar and a bite of yogurt at the same time. Still couldn't eat the whole thing. Thankfully I bought these when they were on deal and my brother in law does like them so it wasnt a total waste. The texture is like raw cookie dough. They taste nothing like a cinnamon roll.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: Delicious! Not a strong B-day Cake flavor though
customer_reviews.text: These are delicious! However, they lose a star because they don't really taste much like birthday cake. And the frosting flakes off a bit as you eat it. So, if you're wearing a black shirt, the crumbs settle on it, and mush into the shirt fabric because that frosting substance is soft - this is a logistical issue though. They're the right amount of sweet and unlike some other bars of this type, they do NOT have that chemical taste which is a big plus. I'll still buy them - just amp up the b-day cake flavor it's 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: SCM

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite mashup!
customer_reviews.text: I love this flavor! I don’t know where Quest has been hiding this mashup of a brownie / cookie dough but I’m thrilled to have found it! The brownie part has a few nut pieces to satisfy and cookie part pieces of chocolate chunks. Definitely takes care of sweet cravings without blowing your diet. It’s not terribly sweet so it doesn’t activate the sugar monster. I think I found a new favorite!
customer_reviews.author: amzingrl

customer_reviews.title: Have a horrid aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Quest bars because they were recommended by some (now known) idiot online. I usually buy Combat Crunch Chocolate Cake (delicious, btw) but decided to give these a try on a whim. They were so God-awful, I gave them to a homeless man outside my local grocery store. When I was finished, on my way out, he handed the box back to me and said thank you, but NO. A homeless man, presumably hungry, said no to these after trying one.
customer_reviews.author: M. Liddell

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend Quest Bars for Dieting!
customer_reviews.text: I started aggressively dieting 7 months ago, and I owe much of my success to Quest Bars (60lbs lost!). Quest Bars are great for diets as they are low in calories and high in protein. In layman's terms, they make you feel full on few calories. I frequently use Quest Bars as a meal replacement or as a midday snack to curb my hunger. Flavors are an important consideration when buying, since some are disgusting. To start, I recommend buying the variety pack. Once you know which flavors you like, you can order individual flavors in bulk. My favorite flavors: 1) Chocolate Peanut Butter 2) Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough 3) Double Chocolate Chunk
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Hard with an aftertaste
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these on a recommendation thinking they were going to be a great part of my getting healthy journey. The flavor is tolerable but not worthy of exciting my taste buds. The texture was tolerable but still tasted like a typical cheap protein bar. The bars are hard by the way not not exactly pleasurable to bite in to. So overall, I won't purchase again and doubt I will even eat what I purchased. They are just not worth the cost in calories for me. I doubt anyone who is limited on what they can eat in a day would want to waste food intake on such an item. I am sadly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Used to be good. No More
customer_reviews.text: The new formula Quest bars are just terrible. Why would they do such a thing. Many people cannot tolerate corn, Corn is known to cause inflammation. I used to buy these all the time. Quest has truly ruined a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Item was almost expired and tasted horrible
customer_reviews.text: I am a regular consumer of Quest Raspberry Shortcake bars. These bars were only a month from their expiration date. OMG...I took a chance and tried one. It was horrible!! I can't even describe the hideous taste. I only purchase Amazon prime products and in the last year I have noticed that many of the vitamins, supplements and food items that I order are really close to the expiration date. So close that they will expire before I can use the entire product. I am getting tired of paying for old crap!! AMAZON NEEDS TO DO BETTER!!
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: A Throw-away.
customer_reviews.text: Having tried many brands of high protein bars for two years, when I spotted this NEW Quest bar I was happy to discover flavors I enjoy. Sadly, after eating just 1/3 of a bar I threw the remainder away. The taste is NOT GOOD, the consistency is that of paste and flour. Very disappointing. I'll stick with my ONE cinnamon bar.
customer_reviews.author: JOANNE SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Cinnamon roll flavor is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This may be the worst flavor that Quest offers in a protein bar. Only faintly tastes like a cinnamon roll; mostly tastes like the Waffles and Maple Syrup flavor (which does not taste like waffles). Such a big contrast with the best Quest flavors: mint chocolate chunk, s'mores, and white chocolate raspberry. Plus, you are lucky if you get a fresh batch, even if the expiration date is far off. I think these boxes are stored in a very hot place, so they dry out.
customer_reviews.author: David Spector

customer_reviews.title: Very good protein bars
customer_reviews.text: If you are not familiar with QuestBars, they are one of the goo-based protein bars as opposed to the chalky filling or chocolate coated ones. This is one of the best flavors, its a vanilla or cake flavored base with some sort of crumble and what seems like real dried blueberries dispersed throughout. Very strong blueberry taste, but I am a big fan of blueberry flavoring. No aftertaste, and no digestive issues (some people may be sensitive to the fiber content). 9/10.
customer_reviews.author: adam jacoby

customer_reviews.title: Yuck
customer_reviews.text: It's rare I write a negative review, however this bar looks nothing and I mean 'nothing's like the picture shown. There is Zero caramel that will ooze from the bar as if you were eating a Caramello candy bar..which is exactly what made me hit the Add button. It's all pressed together compact as a hot dog only like a chocolate/caramel sort of way..it's gross. And this girl can eat anything chocolate..it's truly my weakness..but, this...this just ain't even right.
customer_reviews.author: April B

customer_reviews.title: Most Satisfying and Flavorful Protein Bar!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brands of protein bars, and most were fairly good. However, after eating my first Quest Nutrition Protein Bar, I feel like I've eaten a real treat. It was fresh, filling and satisfying. I truly enjoyed it! My first was the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough. Chewy, thick, yummy. Having Lyme disease, I have to stay away from sugar and high carbs. I need to have high protein in my diet, and this is definitely a safe, healthy avenue for me with no soy. Can't wait to try other flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Spiritual Sojourner

customer_reviews.title: Decent flavor and unique taste!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Quest Bar since its flavors are exactly as written on the description. I was curious at its flavor and it didn't disappoint; it tasted exactly like maple waffle...! I have tried numerous of their flavors, and this one was just okay; it wasn't the best tasteful one. Nevertheless, if you are curious while maintaining macro-friendly snack every once in a while, I do recommend trying these out!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Keto Post Workout Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Love the quest bars for their keto-friendly contents. With all the stores closed due to Covid-19, it was nice to be able to find these things (and others) on Amazon without price gouging. Also good to note that they didnt change the formula much when the company was purchased from the founder. The nice benefit of the Quest line is the addition of powdered protein shakes in the same flavors as the bars. Thanks Quest Nutrition!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Tastes like a cheat meal! Sooo good!
customer_reviews.text: OMG. These maple waffle bars are UNREAL! My favorite (before these) were the ONE Maple Donut, but the have artificial sweeteners like sucralose so I searched for an alternative and found these. HOLY COW these are amazing! They are reaaally sticky, but totally worth it! The bar is softer than other thought quest bars I’ve had in the past and there are little pockets of syrup and little wafflelike pieces throughout. Seriously didn’t expect much but I am blown away with these. My boyfriend loves them too! Now keep in mind they are very sweet, but this definitely tastes like a cheat meal and it is NOT!
customer_reviews.author: SoFloGal

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Lemon Meringue bars
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the new Quest lemon cake bars would be as tasty as the Quest lemon meringue bars they discontinued, but no such luck! There is no comparison. I could hardly taste the lemon in lemon cake and will not be buying these bars again (I used to eat a Quest lemon meringue bar every day). This is a poor substitute. I hope they bring the Lemon Meringue Bars back!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Zepf

customer_reviews.title: Bars are NOT "Keto friendly"
customer_reviews.text: I really like these bars BUT it says "Keto friendly" in the description and they ARE NOT. I called the company to let them know. They said they would take "Keto friendly" out of the description so we shall see. This bar has soluble corn fiber and sucralose in them. The woman on the phone said these weren't "Keto friendly" too. I believe all of their bars have sucralose in them which are not good for you either. What a shame, I liked them.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I love Quest Bars .....I have spent literally A ton of money every year on several different flavors ....this one unfortunately was too sweet and tasted like chemicals. I really wanted to like them because I wanted something other than chocolate. Perhaps Quest will eventually develop a Lemon protein bar with a better taste🙏🏻.
customer_reviews.author: Sherr

customer_reviews.title: HIDEOUS GAS
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's the recipe or the batch I got, but the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough bars give me the worst, godforsaken flatulence in all the lands. They do make me feel satiated, if satiation equates to bloated stomach and constant expulsions of odious fumes. Strongly do not recommend these. Buying from Amazon's enticing because of the low price, but I think I'll be getting my Quest products in the store from now on.
customer_reviews.author: jib jose

customer_reviews.title: Dissappointed af
customer_reviews.text: I've been a loyal Quest Bar consumer for the past 4 years. As other reviews have noted, the ingredients changed for the worse. Anyways, I ordered a box of the chocolate chip flavor and they were 2 weeks away from the expiration date. They were hard as a rock and were completely inedible. Get it together, Quest Nutrition. You guys were so good.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Lang

customer_reviews.title: Many from the same box were stale
customer_reviews.text: I have been receiving this subscription for Quest chocolate chip bars for a long time. I have usually not had an issue with them. But, one box that I received had about half of the box as stale. Including one that was so hard that it was literally like a brick. How can this happen in the same box as others that are fresh. I am going to give it one more chance and see if another box has this problem. We pay alot for each bar and there have been several that are not edible because they are stale. This is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Larson

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to try these. I love cookies and cream flavored anything so I thought at worst these would be “just okay.” Boy was I wrong. The first bit was disgusting. I tried a couple more bites thinking maybe it just took some getting used to. Nope. Still awful. I threw the rest of that one away and am stuck with the rest of the package. I can’t make myself eat them. I don’t understand how they have so many great reviews.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: My favorite flavor from Quest!
customer_reviews.text: This bar is delicious. I’m a huge fan of hazelnut and this bar definitely gave me that satisfaction. They even have chunks of the nit sprinkled throughout. The other thing that I was impressed with is that this flavor only uses stevia and erythritol which are both naturally derived and no artificial sweeteners like their other protein bar flavors. This is a huge plus for me!
customer_reviews.author: RanBigBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Sucralose
customer_reviews.text: Apparently they make some flavors (4 in this box) without sucralose, and when I researched, I got the impression they were no longer using sucralose. Looks like they updated the listing to include it as an ingredient. I don't consume artificial sweeteners and I don't see why these would need stevia, erythritol AND sucralose! It's just ridiculous, Quest, get with it. So back these go, because I refuse to eat garbage.
customer_reviews.author: trbobtch

customer_reviews.title: Lemon - Pretty Good!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a huge fan of protein bars in general, the texture always throws me off. This one is actually pretty good. Its not just that chewy protein bar, but has small pieces of what taste and feel like crunchy lemon cookies inside, and that seals the deal for me. The bright lemon flavor and crunchy intermixed with chewy texture, make this one a winner!
customer_reviews.author: Chelle Tackett

customer_reviews.title: it seems that they are shipping the worst products to customers
customer_reviews.text: These bars are not fresh, it seems that they are shipping the worst products to customers. I bought 4 boxes, all of them were horrible, the chocolate chips in the bar looked expired and the bars tasted funny. They were inedible, I asked for refund. Be aware.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Protein Bar
customer_reviews.text: 21 grams of protein and only 1 gram of sugar with a great price? I buy these regularly. Quest has many great flavors. This is not my favorite flavor, but Quest is my favorite protein bar. And itʻs not that I donʻt like this flavor - itʻs delicious!! There are just others I like more in the Quest family, but I still get this one for occasional variety. If you like your protein bar to taste like dessert, this is the one for you. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Polland

customer_reviews.title: VOMIT
customer_reviews.text: Disgusting. There is so much sucralose that you get that weird sour/soapy awful taste not only as an after taste but as you eat them. And the testure is nasty. I also tried the microwave trick, hoping it would help and while it improved the texture immensely, they still tasted terrible.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaR

customer_reviews.title: typical protein bar
customer_reviews.text: I realize one can't expect too much here. Can't expect a protein bar to taste like a candy bar. But in order to buy one brand over another, I think it has to be in some way unique. other than the little bits of chips to crunch down on, there is nothing that in any way resembles the cookie dough taste. so its just the typical chewy consistency of a protein bar w/zero flavor. so being that it is not bad or unpleasant (still a plus compared to some that are inedible), I will use until they are gone but won't get again b/c there is nothing special about these for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amy MTop Contributor: Eye Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Best overall protein bar on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dad, who is nearly 80 and lives alone nearly 3000mi away from me. Being in a high risk category with the COVID pandemic, I’ve been sending him stuff like this to keep him full and satisfied. He loves these bars, and so do I. Flavor is good, and they don’t have the chalky bland taste that many protein bars feature. If you count net carbs, most of these come in around 5g. Most of the bars are around 200cals, and are very tasty considering the ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Tried the PB brownie smash bar at my gym and loved it, so I decided to order a whole box. Although the bars that arrived taste okay, this batch is not up to the same quality as the first one I tried. As you can see from my pictures, the entire top layer, the peanut butter side of it, has no chips in it, unlike the packaging as well as the first one I tried. This makes the bar taste pretty bland, and since the whole box is like that I'm disappointed. Especially because these bars are on the more expensive side. I can't order these again until it's clear the quality is more consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money like I did!
customer_reviews.text: Believe the one star reviews these bars are junk and absolutely disgusting and not worth the money. The "Blueberry muffin" tastes like a dry nasty fig newton with no blueberry muffin taste and a waxy texture. Idk where people are thinking this tastes like a blueberry muffin or even considering this tastes good. You must have bad taste buds if you think it's good. Would not recommend or buy one to see if you like it before buying a lot. I was one to trust the 5 star review on these bars and everyone saying it taste like a blueberry muffin so I got 12 but that was a big mistake on my part. Never again
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Lemon is back and even better!
customer_reviews.text: So excited that Lemon is back!! And better than before. This time has some glaze and a stronger flavor of lemon. Fresh and delicious. My box came today and I am already ordering another one so I can share some bars. Bring back apple pie flavor and I will have my 2 favorites!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Great for Keto!
customer_reviews.text: While on the keto diet, I had this as my go-to snack because of the actual low net carbs. These are the best on the market I've found for the keto diet because net carbs is much lower than any of the other products. But you know what is even better? The taste! Every flavor I've tried has been excellent. My favorite is the Birthday Cake, but I haven't found a flavor I disliked other than the white chocolate raspberry just being okay. But if you're looking for a good low-carb, protein snack then you can't go wrong with Quest. Just choose the flavor that appeals to you most!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Best protein bar in the market!
customer_reviews.text: After trying several alternatives, I came back and bought Quest again. This bar is definitely the healthiest choice you could pick in the market. Although it is made with artificial sweeter as others, it contains the least calorie compared to others. Also, it contains a lot of corn fibers which helps you keep a good digesting function. (So basically you could safely eat this for a long time) However, all flavors actually taste pretty similar also the packs are printed with a variety of colors.(do not be cheated by that)
customer_reviews.author: California Hotel

customer_reviews.title: Very Bad Batch
customer_reviews.text: I buy Quest products all the time and thought I’d grab this off of Amazon (I usually buy in store which is pretty pricey) They were nowhere near their expiration date but the chocolate chunks were like chalk! Awful! They really tasted like they were years past their expiration date. I also purchased another pack in the peanut butter brownie smash and they also did the same thing. Old stuff on Amazon? I don’t know but I won’t be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: JR64

customer_reviews.title: Did they EAT one of my Quest Bars?
customer_reviews.text: The flavors of quest bars are always alright. They all have that "protein bar" taste as I like to say. Cookies & Cream is one of the better flavors. Nutritionally, the quest bars are really good. However, I am displeased with purchasing them through amazon now. I opened my package to find the box partially opened and found that one of my quest bars was gone. It's like the shipping guy was hungry. So, he decided to take one of my quest bars for his snack. I am going to think twice now before ordering quest bars from amazon. It was only one bar but still -- I payed for it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo Banda

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Quest bars along with the Pumpkin Pie bars. The Cookie Dough bars are not something I'll buy again. They have an overwhelming chemical taste, and even though I tried to eat them with a hot cup of coffee, I just couldn't finish the bar. I'll put them in the break room of my office and hope someone likes them.
customer_reviews.author: Verna Helm

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I typically LOVE quest bars... this one misses the mark. It has these pockets of fake syrup that have a caramel consistency all over which are kinda gross. They also make for a decent mess if you are trying to eat one in a rush. I was super excited for this flavor but I think they need to tinker with it a bit more. For reference my favorites are pb&j, chocolate chip, and oatmeal chocolate chip. If that helps.
customer_reviews.author: Katy

customer_reviews.title: They're all bad
customer_reviews.text: They're all bad. Every single one of 'em. The (bad) taste is reminiscent of the advertised flavor (mint, cookie dough, whatever). After the initial (confusing) shock--"Wow, this one is bad. I hope the rest aren't this bad"--the aftertaste punishes you. It's an overly sweet + chemical taste + weird texture (made worse if there are chunks of whatever for a given flavor) + bad taste. After the first one, we began cutting them em in half (which was surprisingly difficult) to see if we could munch on em over an hour or so--"maybe they're better in small doses". It was worse because the experience & aftertaste spread out over said hour. Check out Rise bars.
customer_reviews.author: PalmyPenguin

customer_reviews.title: My favorite flavor Quest bars
customer_reviews.text: Blueberry muffin is probably hands down the best flavor in the Quest line for protein bars, and Quest is probably my favorite protein bars compared to other brands. I first started with Quest because I was on the Keto diet and these things are great for someone like me who has a sweet tooth. They taste good, but not super fake (at least to me) and the texture is better than others. I think by now, I tried at least 7 or 8 different flavors but blue berry is my go to.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson T.

customer_reviews.title: Stale bars
customer_reviews.text: This product is normally good, but this shipment of 3 boxes of Quest Chocolate Peanut Butter are all super stale. It is August 2019, the freshness date are April 2020, but they taste nasty, are dry and old looking, and the chocolate chips are discolored or bloomed. Quest is storing their boxes in a very warm place for these to be bad 8 months beforehand. Is am going to be reluctant to buy these again on the future.
customer_reviews.author: musicandfilmbuff

customer_reviews.title: Too sweet, but like the nutrition
customer_reviews.text: I like that these Quest bars have 20 gms of protein, 16 gms of fiber and only 5 net carbs. I wish I would have tried a single bar before ordering a box because they taste overly sweet to me and I don't care for them. I prefer the non chocolate ones sometimes for breakfast and thought I would try something different, I like the Vanilla Almond Crunch better.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Okay flavor, bad after taste
customer_reviews.text: These bars are okay if you're used to eating protein bars. When I first got them, the flavor was pretty good. But, halfway through the box, and I'm at the point where I am having a tough time getting through the entire bar. It isn't that the flavor is bad; there is just an after taste of what I'm guessing is a sugar alcohol that makes me not like them. It is a struggle to finish one. Just make sure you have plenty to drink while eating them.
customer_reviews.author: emets31

customer_reviews.title: Disgusting. Slimy, sticky, chewy, gooey, gross.
customer_reviews.text: Hated this. Huge waste of money. Why does this bar have syrup all over it? I'm so disappointed. Had to come back and write this review. Threw the whole box away. Stay far away from the Maple flavor. The best flavor by far is the Blueberry Cobler. By far!
customer_reviews.author: Knyte

customer_reviews.title: Great taste, decent size, very satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I'm on low carb diet and wanted something that would satisfy craving without eating too many bad carbs. If the labeling is accurate, this isn't high in the carbs that cause weight gain. This is mostly packed with carbs that's basically like psyllium. It surely makes you gas like it has a lot of psyllium. I always eat 2 at a time. Taste great but my taste buds prefer the cookies n cream. I've treat a couple other flavors also. This is my second best.
customer_reviews.author: J. Callum

customer_reviews.title: New version NOT an improvement
customer_reviews.text: I've been eating this flavor of Quest bars for awhile now, and this new version is NOT an improvement. First, these have 190 calories, not 180 as stated in the description. (And as they did previously). Second, the texture is so poor that it's almost unpalatable. Think rubbery and stale. I have been buying these at Trader Joe's individually (this is the first package I've purchased), and I'm amazed at the difference in taste and quality. Super disappointed in this new Quest Bar and probably won't be purchasing again, which totally bums me out because I used to LOVE these things.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Kempen

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy these
customer_reviews.text: DON'T DO IT TO YOURSELF. I used to eat quest bars a lot, and I ordered the chocolate hazelnut flavor. Generally I like chocolate and hazelnuts. Huge mistake. I ate one yesterday morning and was left throwing up anything I tried to eat for the rest of the day. It was traumating. I threw away the remaining 11. The "chocolate" tasted absolutely nothing like chocolate. I wish quest would give me my money back but I know that won't be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Quite tasty
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if its my favorite just yet, (cookie dough still my top), but this might be number 1 soon. Darn tasty.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Campbell

customer_reviews.title: These bars are a staple in my life!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are so mixed on these but I can’t live without them now. They taste good (s’mores and cookie dough are my fav), they fill me up, they satisfy my sweet tooth and they have a low glycemic index. I think they’re fantastic! No stomach problems or ill effects at all. No moldy bars or quality issues and I’m on my 10th 12-bar box from Amazon. Are they comparable to the real foods? Not really. But for protein bars, I’ll never switch brands.
customer_reviews.author: livelaughshop

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite flavors
customer_reviews.text: I've tried probably close to 15 different Quest bar flavors and I'd say this is in my top 5. It's not my favorite, but it's up there. It definitely tastes better than any other brand's birthday cake flavor, which I've always hated. These were the cheapest bars available at the time so I decided to take a chance on them and was pleasantly surprised, especially based on my prior experiences with other brands. I've ordered three total boxes and all three have been fresh and very soft. If these go on sale again, I'll definitely buy more.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: If I wanted bricks for my sidewalk.........
customer_reviews.text: It’s a difficult review to write because my displeasure has nothing to do with the ingredients or taste of this familiar, regularly ordered product. My displeasure lies in the fact that the bars are apparently either so old or poorly stored that they would be great bricks for a sidewalk!!!!! HARDER THAN A BOARD! Can’t even cut with a kitchen knife; almost broke a tooth attempting to take my first bite!! HOW WILL THIS PROBLEM BE RESOLVED!?
customer_reviews.author: Swan

customer_reviews.title: Terrible texture and poor taste
customer_reviews.text: I tried to return it but Amazon doesn't allow returns for any food items, even individually packaged ones. This bar's texture is dense, gooey, and sticky. I find it very unpleasant. Also, the flavor is one of fake butter and mapple - no hint of waffle whatsoever. Think - a child smothered their waffles in margarine and syrup, ate their waffles, then the leftover liquid dried up...that's atune to eating this.
customer_reviews.author: Sly Like a Fox Howls Like a Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Delicious lemon protein bar!
customer_reviews.text: These are amazing! I love Quest bars and have eaten them for years, and this is my new favorite flavor. If you like lemon cakes and lemon squares or anything lemon flavored, try this bar! So good! I also recommend s’mores flavor 😉
customer_reviews.author: Alana Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Just horrible
customer_reviews.text: The worst flavor I've tried. Once I got past the bad, stale nut smell, I couldn't believe the flavor was even worse. I bought a mixed variety box also, and without looking at which flavor it was, grabbed a bar. As soon as I took a bite and got a whiff of the smell, I knew instantly it was this flavor and spit it out. Bring back Apple Pie flavor!!
customer_reviews.author: ANTPan

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy it , please dont waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give less a starr i would The taste is horrible. I just tried one and i didnt like it. So i took it to work to share with friend who also wacth what they eat and no one like it. No even a single person gave a good feed back. I so sad because i still have the whole box and these bars are expiring now in February 2020😔🙁
customer_reviews.author: Lily Matias

customer_reviews.title: Great way to replace a meal.
customer_reviews.text: We like some flavors and don't care that much for others. The birthday cake is good and the chocolate with crunch in them are my favorites. I don't think anybody who wasn't already keto adapted, or paleo, or certainly low carb, would appreciate the taste of these. The Hero Quest bars, which I have also bought, I think are a little better. But these are fine. And this is a good price for these they're about $0.50 higher at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: L. Harper

customer_reviews.title: The stevia aftertaste is a deal-breaker for me
customer_reviews.text: These are OK. The aroma and taste is good, but for my taste, they'd be better without the stevia. There's already plenty of sweetness with the erythritol. The additional sweetener makes them too sweet and leaves a bad aftertaste. (Some people won't mind the stevia so obviously, your mileage may vary. I will admit, it's mild and I'm extra sensitive to it.) The texture takes some getting used to: it's a bit like dried out chewing gum. I could get used to this for the whopping 20g protein in each bar. But because of the stevia, I'm going hunting for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: K. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Definitive Ranking of Quest Bar Flavors
customer_reviews.text: Quest bars are a staple of my nutrition plan. I eat at least one per day and have for the past two years. Here's my "definitive" ranking of Quest bar flavors. It's subjective, but I speak from experience: Da bomb - Maple waffle, chocolate chip cookie dough, chocolate sprinkled doughnut, cinnamon roll Great - Smash bar, cookies and cream, mint chocolate chunk, caramel chocolate chunk, double chocolate chunk Good - Chocolate hazelnut, chocolate peanut butter, mocha, rocky road Meh - Birthday cake, blueberry muffin, oatmeal chocolate chip, s'mores, white chocolate raspberry, vanilla almond crunch Nope - Chocolate brownie, strawberry cheesecake
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flavorful--love the sprinkles!
customer_reviews.text: When I have to satisfy a sweet tooth, this is the bar for me! It's packed with nutrition and yet is full of flavor and good, healthy ingredients. It will also keep me full for a couple of hours. I take these bars when I travel because if I'm on a day tour and feel hungry, I know this bar will get me through to the next meal. I highly recommend this one, but I also like many of the other flavors, too.
customer_reviews.author: Linda K. Buckley

customer_reviews.title: Way sweeter than needs to be
customer_reviews.text: I have tried cookies and cream, and cookie dough flavors, all I can say - will never be buying them again nor will be trying other flavors. Main problem is not a flavor itself, nor I have issues with stevia, I actually take stevia over erythritol any time, but these protein bars are way too sweet, which is unfortunately the case for many other brands. In case of cookies and cream, it's so sweet that remaining 11 bars are going to trash.
customer_reviews.author: Vidis

customer_reviews.title: Quest Bars
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted Birthday Cake bar but didn't have any, so I wanted to try this Chocolate Hazelnut Protein Bar and I didn't care for the taste or texture. It just leaves a bad taste. Now I'm stuck with this protein bar and I have try to get use to the taste but just couldn't do it. Will never buy this type of protein bar ever again.
customer_reviews.author: George Manning

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, tasted terrible and weird texture
customer_reviews.text: I normally like Quest products but I am not a fan of these protein bars. I thought they tasted gross and the texture was weird and rubbery. If was without food on an island and this was my only food option, then yes, I would eat them. I am sure they do give you energy and they do have a lot of protein, they are just not for me. I donated them to a local food bank because I felt guilty throwing them away.
customer_reviews.author: PAW

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I got this to supplement my keto diet but the flavors just weren’t very good. It wasn’t terrible, but there are better options out there. My favorite right now is the Kirkland brand protein bars. They don’t have as many flavors, but their flavors taste much better, in my opinion. This is ok for a change of pace, but not something I’d recommend for a regular thing.
customer_reviews.author: JRay

customer_reviews.title: Tastes terrible!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Mocha Chocolate Chip flavor & delivery was quick unfortunately it was delivered hot & melting. 😭 I'd never had the flavor/brand before & decided to go for a flavor that sounded yummy. Unfortunately it tastes terrible! I threw it away! I had to eat & something to get the taste out of my mouth. I'm not sure what caused the nasty taste as I'm used to Keto friendly sweeteners 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Seitz

customer_reviews.title: Quality of flavors ranges from average to excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different flavors so far and have found that the quality varies considerably from one flavor to the next. The Maple Waffle, Cooke Dough, Chocolate Peanut Butter and Birthday Cake bars are all fantastic, especially if you heat them up in the microwave for a good 10-15 seconds. The Strawberry Cheesecake is not good. It's quite bland and the worst of all the ones I've tried. Mint Chocolate is okay, but a little dry and chalky. Same goes for the Blueberry Muffin bars.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Yuck - very dry and tastes like artificial sweeteners
customer_reviews.text: Review for Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Flavor I don't know how this bar has such good reviews. Maybe they're the best of the bunch in the high protein space, but I found them incredibly dry and tasted like chemicals. The nasty taste is probably the sucralose. I wish I had noticed the artificial sweeteners in it, because I find the taste of them to be horrible. Also, they're so dry, there was no way for me to eat it without a mess. Every bite had crumbles raining down on my shirt. Maybe the other flavors are better, or I got a bad bar, but I'd never take a chance on this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Taste like cookies!
customer_reviews.text: I love these in the morning before I take my medicines! I take enough medicines to keep a 80-year-old woman kicking and need something to eat with them or else I throw up. I don't like cooking really early in the morning and I am often running off to work so these are a lifesaver. These and a cup of coffee tide me over from 6-11 and taste like a chocolate chip cookie! Love it
customer_reviews.author: K_Thed4ord

customer_reviews.title: Oh NO!
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why on earth this bar is rated so high-- The taste was absolutely horrible! I expected some taste resembling strawberry or cream or something, but instead, just tastes like chemicals. The consistency is similar, if not a bit tougher than other quest bars, but the aftertaste is the worst thing ever. SO hated them to. I cannot recommend you buy ANY OTHER FLAVOR enough. Because this strawberry cheesecake is rank!
customer_reviews.author: EvieM

customer_reviews.title: They are not fresh!
customer_reviews.text: I subscribe to these boxes, and lately they are not fresh. I have consumed quest bars now for awhile so when i buy a fresh box at the grocery store the texture and taste is different. I think When these are stored at hot temperatures (in a truck) they melt, and then get re-frozen and it significantly changes to the taste and texture. You can also immediately tell once you open the box and see if all the wrappers are stuck to the bars. Disappointed and thinking about cancelling my subscription and just buying at the grocery/gnc stores.
customer_reviews.author: durantk

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorites
customer_reviews.text: I typically don't care for protein bars- I find they tend to have a strange texture and I don't prefer to choke down a meal ever. But trying the donut sprinkle bars changed the game for me. I personally think they taste similar to actual chocolate covered donuts and even have sprinkles on them so it feels like I am having a treat, while also keeping me full for a few hours. So yum!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Made me sick
customer_reviews.text: The last batch of these made me sick to my stomach, I ate a 2nd one just to be sure it wasn't something else, and it made me sick again. None of the other flavors of Quest protein bars cause this issue, not sure if it's a bad batch or what, but I won't buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Luckado

customer_reviews.title: They’re as delicious and fresh as any Atkins product. Just eat them and stay healthy!
customer_reviews.text: These are delicious and a nice filler between meals. I see people post a difference in color or size for the bars sold on Amazon and that’s not an issue. Unless you care to measure all your bars and raise a brow when one is shorter by 1/8th of an inch, or it’s coloring is t perfect, eat them. I’ve never put mine on display, just a delicious meal replacement when the growl starts between food meals.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Very lemony!
customer_reviews.text: If you like an intense lemon flavor then this bar is for you. Very soft and chewy with a bright, lemony flavor that was actually very nice. I normally go for chocolate flavors but this was a nice change.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S. Schmuck

customer_reviews.title: Best tasting protein bars on the market
customer_reviews.text: The Quest chocolate chip cookie dough protein bars are the best tasting (by a huge margin) protein bars I've ever used. I always keep a couple in my bag in case I have to miss a meal while working. 21 grams of protein and only one gram of sugar is pretty darn nice. If your looking for a new protein bar to try I would recommend you give these a shot.
customer_reviews.author: Pearce

customer_reviews.title: The fake sweetener ruins this product!
customer_reviews.text: The first bite was good. Then the after taste came through. Oh my gosh! It was ghastly! It became more unpleasant as I went along until the bar didn’t taste like cinnamon roll anymore but fake sweetener after taste. Ugh!! What am I going to do with the rest of the box? And all of the bakery goods in this brand have that same fake sweetener in them!
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Dang, that’s good!
customer_reviews.text: Holy Mother of God! It’s beyond Quest Nutrition in a cake like protein bar! In other words, it’s delicious. Better than a real lemon cake but is packed into a protein bar. Actually, i couldn’t tell the difference other than it’s low carb! No guilt!
customer_reviews.author: Flipflops2heels

customer_reviews.title: Good bar but inaccurate nutrition facts
customer_reviews.text: The bar taste amazing like a real chocolate donut but just very disappointed in the nutrition facts being inaccurate. Fats are 9 calories per gram, carbs and protein are each 4 calories per gram if you add it all up the real total calories is 245 NOT 190 always check labels alot are inaccurate and a lot of companies lie to sell products.
customer_reviews.author: GJ™️

product_meta.title: Quest Nutrition Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Bar, High Protein, Low Carb, Gluten Free, Keto Friendly, 12 Count
product_meta.description: Style:Protein Bar| Flavor:Chocolate Peanut Butter| Size:2.12 Ounce (Pack of 12)Chocolate Peanut Butter: The time-tested flavor of chocolate and peanut butter, what can be more craveable? We’ve perfected the taste, so all you have to do is indulge.
feature_bullets: YOU DESERVE A SPECIAL TREAT: The Quest Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Bars taste like an indulgent chocolate and peanut butter treat. Only our bar has 20g protein, 5g net carbs and 1g of sugar per bar
UNWRAP COMPLETE PROTEINS: The Quest Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Bars are made with complete, dairy-based proteins to provide your body with 9 essential amino acids
FIBER IS YOUR FRIEND: The Quest Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Bars have 13g of fiber to provide your body with a more complete macro profile
SWEET WITHOUT ADDED SUGAR: Enjoy the rewarding taste of chocolate and peanut butter without worrying about added sugars. The Quest Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Bar has no added sugars
TREATS THAT TRAVEL WITH YOU: Take Quest Chocolate Peanut Butter Protein Bars with you in your backpack, purse, car console, cup holder, gym bag or wherever your adventures take you
Box contains 12 Chocolate Peanut Butter flavored Quest Protein Bars

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
